title: Is being rational and intelligent the same thing? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, in fact, in scientific studies, there doesn’t seem to be much of a connection between the two. Being rational means being objective — honestly assessing a situation without regard to one’s feelings or beliefs, and acting on that assessment without regard to emotionality. Think Mr. Spock. Being intelligent means being able to understand and solve complex problems that are new to you, in other words, that require you to use your own mind rather than skill or knowledge that you’ve learned from somebody else. There are many examples of extremely intelligent people who aren’t particularly rational.

hi It is intelligent to be rational and rationality requires some intelligence but they are not the same thing. They overlap is all Emotions are subconscious thought complexes and draw on all available data and experience in an irrational yet often highly insightful and intelligent way. Intelligence can be both counterintuitive and irrational. Best wishes :)
